page.title: 10SCHOOL OF MANAGEMENT.
page.content: The{School of Management}work for the Cranfield Institute of Technology and represents 20% of it. To teach there you do not need any qualifications, but you must have credibility with businessmen. The management part of the Institute has 3 campuses. They are at Shrivenham, at Silsoe, and also at Cranfield (the largest). 20% of their funding comes from the {Department of Education and Science, the rest they supply themselves. The School have a turnover of Â£4.5 million per annum which is 10% of the Institute's total turnover. Of the 1000 _ 1200 students, 20% have a foreign nationality, and only 10 out of 150 students fail their exams. A 4th School of Management is going to start in Malaya, South East Asia. The school of management is an example of the Institute catering to demand.
